intro: Borreria spinosa, commonly known as the spiny borreria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, small white or pale yellow flowers, and small, elliptical leaves. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to hot, dry environments. Borreria spinosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
